update.description:
* Same saving/exiting flow which was implemented for the Building Editor on pull request #1312, but adapted for the Model Editor:

![popups1.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/2775725964-popups1.png)

* The Model Editor had been using `gui/SaveDialog` while the Building Editor was using `gui/building/FinishBuildingDialog`. I basically copied `FinishBuildingDialog` into `SaveDialog` and got rid of the original one instead of duplicating code.

* While at it, also PIMPLized `SaveDialog`

* Also moved some functionality from `BuildingMaker` to `SaveDialog`, where it can be used by both editors. Things like `GetFolderNameFromModelName`, `AddDirToModelPaths`, `GenerateConfig`, `SaveToConfig`, and so on.

* Got rid of the save/exit buttons on the palette and added a field for the model name.

* You'll also see a lot of calls to `ModelCreator::ModelChanged`, I hope I was able to track every time the user adds/deletes/modifies something. Currently this is just used to know if there are changes to be saved in the model, but hopefully this will help a future Undo feature.

* Related issues: #1419, #1336, #1326, #1335
update.title: Model Editor: Saving, exiting, generalizing SaveDialog

content.raw:
one minor comment about the file exist dialog:

It says `A model named XXX already exists..`. This is probably not always true because I could change the model name in Advanced Options and try save it again but it would still give the same warning message. Maybe this meant to say the folder already exist?
content.html:
one minor comment about the file exist dialog:

It says A model named XXX already exists... This is probably not always true because I could change the model name in Advanced Options and try save it again but it would still give the same warning message. Maybe this meant to say the folder already exist?

content.raw: You mean you are able to make it crash? If I save to `~/model_editor_models`, it saves properly and then I have `/home/louisep/` in my insert tab. No crashes and when I go back into the editor the default is back there.
content.html: You mean you are able to make it crash? If I save to ~/model_editor_models, it saves properly and then I have /home/louisep/ in my insert tab. No crashes and when I go back into the editor the default is back there.

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Saving, exiting, generalizing SaveDialog

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Saving, exiting, generalizing SaveDialog

content.raw:
This happened because you saved using Ctrl+S and the mouse event was still registering that Ctrl when you tried to snap.

I fixed by removing the check for Ctrl on MouseRelease on GLWidget, which I think has no bad consequences, because we shouldn't allow multi-selection during RTS modes until multi-model manipulation is implemented anyways. I also removed a comment which came with it, because I think the Ctrl wasn't doing what the comment says.

8dc53b5
content.html:
This happened because you saved using Ctrl+S and the mouse event was still registering that Ctrl when you tried to snap.

I fixed by removing the check for Ctrl on MouseRelease on GLWidget, which I think has no bad consequences, because we shouldn't allow multi-selection during RTS modes until multi-model manipulation is implemented anyways. I also removed a comment which came with it, because I think the Ctrl wasn't doing what the comment says.

8dc53b5

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Saving, exiting, generalizing SaveDialog

content.raw:
1. Create 2 shapes
1. Save
1. Try to snap shapes together

The whole model will get highlighted and the snap tool won't work. If the model editor is exited, Gazebo crashes.
content.html:
1. Create 2 shapes
  2. Save
  3. Try to snap shapes together

The whole model will get highlighted and the snap tool won't work. If the model editor is exited, Gazebo crashes.

content.raw: If I open the model editor, click on the simple shape icon and hover the transparent shape in the scene, but don't click to place it, the "Unsaved Changes" dialog comes up. If I choose "Save and Exit", then it saves the model with the shape placed in the location I hovered over.
content.html: If I open the model editor, click on the simple shape icon and hover the transparent shape in the scene, but don't click to place it, the "Unsaved Changes" dialog comes up. If I choose "Save and Exit", then it saves the model with the shape placed in the location I hovered over.
